vialab.simpleMultiTouch

Class GestureHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • vialab.simpleMultiTouch.GestureHandler

  • public class GestureHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    It handles the TuioCursor events, sees if a gesture has been performed, and if so, it triggers the gesture's action.

    University of Ontario Institute of Technology. Summer Research Assistant with Dr. Christopher Collins (Summer 2011) collaborating with Dr. Mark Hancock.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Erik Paluka

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GestureHandler()
      Gesture Handler constructor, gets the gesture and TUIO methods from the Processing sketch if the student has overridden them.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GestureHandler

        public GestureHandler()
        Gesture Handler constructor, gets the gesture and TUIO methods from the Processing sketch if the student has overridden them.

    • Method Detail

      • detectOnAdd

        public void detectOnAdd(Zone zone,
               TUIO.TuioCursor tcur,
               int xIn,
               int yIn)
        Tests if gestures, that require an addTuioCursor event, have been performed. If yes, it triggers the gesture's action.
        Parameters:
        zone - Zone - The zone on the top-most layer that contains the coordinates of the TuioCursor.
        tcur - TuioCursor - The TuioCursor that has just moved on the screen.

      • detectOnRemove

        public void detectOnRemove(Zone zone,
                  TUIO.TuioCursor tcur,
                  int xIn,
                  int yIn)
        Tests if gestures, that require a removeTuioCursor event, have been performed. If yes, it triggers the gesture's action.
        Parameters:
        zone - Zone - The zone on the top-most layer that contains the coordinates of the TuioCursor.
        tcur - TuioCursor - The TuioCursor that has just moved on the screen.

      • firePinchEvent

        public void firePinchEvent(int x,
                  int y,
                  long[] cursors,
                  float scl,
                  float sclX,
                  float sclY,
                  int xPofScale,
                  int yPofScale,
                  Zone zone)
        Fires a pinch event. First fires the event in the Processing PApplet if the student has implemented the method. If the event has not been handled then it goes through the zone list until it has been handled.
        Parameters:
        x - int - The x-coordinate of the event
        y - int - The y-coordinate of the event
        cursors - long[] - The cursors involved in the event (their session IDs)
        scl - float - The scale amount
        sclX - float - The X scale amount
        sclY - float - The Y scale amount

      • fireDragEvent

        public void fireDragEvent(int x,
                 int y,
                 long[] cursors,
                 float xDist,
                 float yDist,
                 Zone zone)
        Fires a drag event. First fires the event in the Processing PApplet if the student has implemented the method. If the event has not been handled then it goes through the zone list until it has been handled.
        Parameters:
        x - int - The x-coordinate of the event
        y - int - The y-coordinate of the event
        cursors - long[] - The cursors involved in the event (their session IDs)
        xDist - float - The movement in the x-direction
        yDist - float - The movement in the y-direction

      • fireRotateEvent

        public void fireRotateEvent(int x,
                   int y,
                   long[] cursors,
                   int xPofRotation,
                   int yPofRotation,
                   float angle,
                   Zone zone)
        Fires a rotate event. First fires the event in the Processing PApplet if the student has implemented the method. If the event has not been handled then it goes through the zone list until it has been handled.
        Parameters:
        x - int - The x-coordinate of the event
        y - int - The y-coordinate of the event
        cursors - long[] - The cursors involved in the event (their session IDs)
        xPofRotation - int - the x-coordinate of the point of rotation
        yPofRotation - int - the y-coordinate of the point of rotation
        angle - float - The angle of rotation

      • fireHSwipeEvent

        public void fireHSwipeEvent(int x,
                   int y,
                   long[] cursors,
                   Zone zone,
                   int swipeType)
        Fires a horizontal swipe event. First fires the event in the Processing PApplet if the student has implemented the method. If the event has not been handled then it goes through the zone list until it has been handled.
        Parameters:
        x - int - The x-coordinate of the event
        y - int - The y-coordinate of the event
        cursors - long[] - The cursors involved in the event (their session IDs)
        zone - Zone - The zone associated with the HSwipeEvent
        swipeType - int - The type of swipe -> -1 for left swipe, 1 for right swipe

      • fireVSwipeEvent

        public void fireVSwipeEvent(int x,
                   int y,
                   long[] cursors,
                   Zone zone,
                   int swipeType)
        Fires a vertical swipe event. First fires the event in the Processing PApplet if the student has implemented the method. If the event has not been handled then it goes through the zone list until it has been handled.
        Parameters:
        x - int - The x-coordinate of the event
        y - int - The y-coordinate of the event
        cursors - long[] - The cursors involved in the event (their session IDs)
        zone - Zone - The zone associated with the HSwipeEvent
        swipeType - int - The type of swipe -> -1 for down swipe, 1 for up swipe

      • fireTapEvent

        public void fireTapEvent(int x,
                int y,
                long[] cursors,
                int taps,
                Zone zone)
        Fires a tap event. First fires the event in the Processing PApplet if the student has implemented the method. If the event has not been handled then it goes through the zone list until it has been handled.
        Parameters:
        x - int - The x-coordinate of the event
        y - int - The y-coordinate of the event
        cursors - long[] - The cursors involved in the event (their session IDs)
        taps - int - The number of taps

      • fireTapAndHoldEvent

        public void fireTapAndHoldEvent(int x,
                       int y,
                       long[] cursors,
                       long time,
                       Zone zone)
        Fires a tap and hold event. First fires the event in the Processing PApplet if the student has implemented the method. If the event has not been handled then it goes through the zone list until it has been handled.
        Parameters:
        x - int - The x-coordinate of the event
        y - int - The y-coordinate of the event
        cursors - long[] - The cursors involved in the event (their session IDs)
        taps - int - The number of taps

        public static float getAngleABC(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float a,
                java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float b,
                java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float c)
        Calculates and returns the angle between the three points in Radians.
        Parameters:
        a - Point.Float - First Point
        b - Point.Float - Second Point
        c - Point.Float - Third Point
        Returns:
        float The angle between the three points in Radians
